english.hint: Being angry about something that happened in the past.
Something that’s abundant in quantity and/or cheap; something that’s easily acquired.

english.phrase: A Fool And His Money Are Soon Parted
english.hint: It’s easy for someone acting foolish with their money to lose it.

english.phrase: A Friend In Need Is a Friend Indeed
english.hint: A real friend will be there to help when you need it.

Something that’s extremely difficult to understand due to how complex it is; unintelligible.

english.phrase: An Apple a Day Keeps The Doctor Away

Something that is very pricey; expensive.
Someone with a good memory.
Cherishing someone or something; being fond of another.
Someone that has a lot of work to do.
To go back to the beginning; back to the drawing board.
Starting over again because of a previously failed attempt.
To make a wrong assumption about something.
To bring up an issue that has already been resolved.
Someone who avoids the main point.

english.phrase: Beauty Is In The Eye Of The Beholder

It’s better to choose the safer option than a riskier one that you may later regret.

english.phrase: Between a Rock And a Hard Place
english.hint: Being faced with two difficult choices, where neither are satisfactory.

english.phrase: Birds Of a Feather Flock Together
english.hint: People tend to associate with others who share similar interests or values.
To break down a social stiffness.
Someone who breaks things due to clumsiness.

Only what is essential; no more than what is necessary.

Finally committing to a tough decision.
Seeing something that strongly reminds you of the past.
To be amazed or impressed.
Acquiring money from work.

english.phrase: Burn a Hole In My Pocket
english.hint: Eager to spend money.

english.phrase: Bury Your Head In The Sand

Coming close to a successful outcome only to fall short at the end.
Quitting a bad habit suddenly.
To express sorrow in an insincere way.
It’s useless to worry about things that have already happened and cannot be changed.
Someone who is lying.
An American nickname for a cup of coffee.
Typically said to indicate that any further investigation into a situation may lead to harm.
To meet a required standard; to meet expectations.
Getting directly to the point, leaving out all of the unnecessary details.
Having nothing to say; speechless.
Caught in the act of doing something that you weren’t supposed to be doing.
Your thoughts on something have become different.

Getting a fresh start, without the problems that came before.
When one team soundly wins against another.
Nervous or hesitant about doing something.
To intentionally ignore someone.
To tell the truth, admitting something.
Not agitated; calm.
Someone who is lazy.

english.phrase: Cross That Bridge When We Get There

When something unexpected happens.
Incapable of performing normal functions due to some reason.
Someone or something that looks to be defeated, or nearly so.
Practical or humble; unpretentious.
A tense situation in a competition where things are evenly matched and the outcome is going to be decided only in the last few seconds.
Failing to recall a memory; unable to remember something.
Someone who is greatly annoyed or frustrated.
People who have fallen down ill or who have died in large numbers.
Someone in a competition, either a team or an individual, that has the potential to win it all.
A time where nothing is going on and there is silence.
When someone sees something that causes them to freeze up in fear or surprise.
To avoid a situation that would have been very troublesome to deal with.
A small container for bringing home spare food from a restaurant.
Something that hss been repeated so many times it has become bland and boring.
Noticing something so peculiar that you have to check it twice to make sure what you saw was real.
Feeling sad or depressed; under the weather.
Resources, such as money or time, that have gone to waste.
To make a mistake.
Something that is easy to do.
A person might say this if they are confident that they will outperform someone else.
Having confidence in a specific outcome; being almost sure about something.
Ignoring a large, obvious problem or failing to address an issue that stands out in a major way.

english.phrase: Even a Broken Clock Is Right Twice a Day

Including nearly everything possible.

Putting yourself in a risky situation in order to help someone.

An expression that’s used to describe something that is very fast.

To calm down; to get control over yourself and your emotions; to get a hold of yourself.
When a person gets agitated or upset over something.

Putting a problem behind you.

Used as an advanced warning. To become keenly aware.

Making things more even or fair for both sides.
